note.p: Birth: Parish of St Dunstan-in-the-West, London, England (24 May 1640)
Death: An Apothecary's house, at the sign of the Anchor, York Street, Covent Garden, London (October 1679)
Burial: Church of St Paul, Covent Garden, London
Education: Wadham College, Oxford (matriculated 1658); BCL (1665), DCL (1670)
Career: Fellow of All Souls', Oxford (1660); practised at Bath during the summer season
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; DSB; Hunter; Foster
References: L G Wilson, 'William Croone's Theory of Muscular Contraction' in NR 1961 vol 16 pp 158-178
A Rupert Hall, 'Isaac Newton and the Aerial Nitre' in NR 1998 vol 52 pp 51-61

Notes: Hunter gives birth date as 1641. The DSB entry for John Mayow has quite widely differing dates and places, which have not been entered above. They are as follows: b. Bray, near Looe, Dec 1641; d. London, Sep 1679. It may be that there has been some confusion between Bray in Berkshire and a Bray, near Looe, in Cornwall.
